The fete, a celebration of dance, music and ritual theatre, will culminate on Mahashivaratri

The fete, a celebration of dance, music and ritual theatre, will culminate on Mahashivaratri.— Photo: Special Arrangement

The curtain goes up on Tantrotsav 2016, a celebration of dance, music and ritual theatre, on Sunday.

The venue of the events is the Yogishananda Peetham, Edayanchavadi Road, Near Adi Shakti, Udayan, Auroville. Hosted by the Hindustan Kalarigram, the nine-day festival of ‘living tantra’ will commence with Bharatanatyam exponent Rajashree Warrier’s dance residency workshop on exploring manodharma or improvisation.

The highlights include daily kalaripayattu classes from 6 –7 a.m., satsangs that explore the ancient sciences and spiritual journeys in their contemporary context and Bharatanatyam, Odissi, Theyyam, Ottanthullal, Carnatic music and theatre performance that are open to the public.

The fete will culminate on Mahashivaratri falling on March 7, with a full day programme featuring body practice demonstrations, conversations, dance, music, kalarippayattu, and ritual theatre performance.

The concluding day will feature meditation, discussions, temple procession to percussion rhythms, demonstrations of traditional Indian gymnastics alongside Parkour, a fast evolving modern physical training practise, and the fiery martial form kalarippayattu. A dance performance by Rajashree Warrier is also scheduled. Admission is free to this community event, organisers said. Enquiries can be directed to yogishanandapeetham@ gmail.com
title: Nine-day Tantrotsav from tomorrow
